statement:
Let $ X\in \textbf{L}^2$ be a real-valued random variable with mean
$ \mu=\mathbb{E}[X]$ and variance $ \sigma^2=\operatorname{Var} [X]$.
Then for any standard of accuracy $t>0$,
$${\mathbb{P}_{}\left\{\left| X - \mu \right| \ge t\right\}} \le \frac{\sigma^2}{t^2}.$$
